results.title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 120 West Pike Street in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, as the "Police Officer Scott Bashioum Post Office Building".
results.short_title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 120 West Pike Street in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, as the "Police Officer Scott Bashioum Post Office Building".
results.committees: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
results.latest_major_action: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
results.summary: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 120 West Pike Street in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, as the "Police Officer Scott Bashioum Post Office Building."
results.summary_short: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 120 West Pike Street in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, as the "Police Officer Scott Bashioum Post Office Building."

actions.description: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3459; text: CR S3459)
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 92.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Johnson without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
